Value.label: Activate / deactivate functions ALL ON/ALL OFF
Value.Help: Smart Plug 16A module responds to commands ALL ON / ALL OFF that may be sent by the main controller or by other controller belonging to the system

Item.label: ALL ON active, ALL OFF active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF is not active
ALL ON is not active ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF is not active

Value.label: Automatic turning off relay after set time
Value.Help: 0 => Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 32535 => 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s). Auto OFF enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter 15. Default value 0

Value.label: Automatic turning on relay after set time
Value.Help: 0 - Auto OFF disabled. 1 - 32535 => 1 second (0,01s) - 32535 seconds (325,35s). Auto ON enabled with define time, step is 1s or 10ms according to parameter 15. Default value 0

Value.label: Automatic turning on/off seconds or milliseconds selection
Saving the state of the relay after a power failure

Item.label: Smart Plug 16A module saves its state before power failure (it returns to the last position saved before a power failure)
Smart Plug 16A module does not save the state after a power failure, it returns to off position.

Value.label: Watt Power Consumption Reporting Threshold for Smart plug 16A
Value.Help: default value 20 - 0 - Power consumption reporting disabled - 1 - 100 = 1% - 100% Power consumption reporting enabled. New value is reported only when Wattage in real time changes by more than the percentage value set in this parameter compared to the previous Wattage reading, starting at 1% (the lowest value possible).

Value.label: Watt Power Consumption Reporting Time Threshold for Smart plug 16A Load
Value.Help: default value 20 - 0 - Power consumption reporting disabled - 30 - 32535 = 30 - 32535 seconds. Power consumption reporting enabled. Report is sent according to time interval (value) set here.

Value.label: Down value
Value.Help: Lower power threshold used in parameter no. 52. default value 30 = 30 W - 0 – 4000 = 0W – 4000 W - Down value cannot be higher than a value specified in parameter no. 51

Value.label: Up value
Value.Help: Upper power threshold used in parameter no. 52 default value 50 = 50 W - 0 – 4000 = 0 W – 400 W - Up value cannot be lower than a value specified in parameter no. 50.

Value.label: Action in case of exceeding defined power values (parameters 50 and 51)
Value.Help: Parameter defines the way 3rd association group devices are controlled, depending on the current power load - default value 6 - 0 – function inactive - 1 – turn the associated devices on, once the power drops below Down value (parameter no. 50) - 2 – turn the associated devices off, once the power drops below Down value (parameter no. 50) - 3 – turn the associated devices on, once the power rises above Up value (parameter no. 51) - 4 – turn the associated devices off, once the power rises above Up value (parameter no. 51) - 5 – 1 and 4 combined. Turn the associated devices on, once the power drops below Down value (parameter no. 50). Turn the associated devices off, once the power rises above Up value (parameter no. 51). - 6 – 2 and 3 combined. Turn the associated devices off, once the power drops below Down value (parameter 50). Turn the associated devices on, once the power rises above Up value (parameter no. 51).

Value.label: Overload safety switch
Value.Help: The function allows for turning off the controlled device in case of exceeding the defined power for more than 3.1s. Controlled device can be turned back on by S-button or sending a control frame. By default this function is inactive. default value 0 - 1 – 4000 = 1 W – 4000W - 0 = function not active

Group.label: Basic on/off of the output state
